citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
On April 5th, 2025, a female adult cavalier dog, identified #021, was found deceased, but this finding was not reported to
the Attending Veterinarian. As such, a necropsy or other follow-up guidance was not provided. The facility reports there
were no overt signs of illness or injury prior to death or upon discovery, nor is there any such indication in facility records;
no other animals were affected. Failure to provide timely information regarding animal health and welfare to the Attending
Veterinarian may compromise oversight of veterinary care. As such, the facility must assure the Attending Veterinarian is
alerted to this issue and must continue to provide for frequent and direct communication of welfare information to the
Attending Veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 9, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
On April 5th, 2025, a female adult cavalier dog, identified #021, was found deceased, but this finding was not reported to 
the Attending Veterinarian. As such, a necropsy or other follow-up guidance was not provided. The facility reports there 
were no overt signs of illness or injury prior to death or upon discovery, nor is there any such indication in facility records; 
no other animals were affected. Failure to provide timely information regarding animal health and welfare to the Attending 
Veterinarian may compromise oversight of veterinary care. As such, the facility must assure the Attending Veterinarian is 
alerted to this issue and must continue to provide for frequent and direct communication of welfare information to the 
Attending Veterinarian. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 9, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
